Sustainability Trends in Copier Rentals: Greening Your Office Equipment

June 17, 2025 Marga Enterprises

As environmental awareness grows, businesses are reevaluating every aspect of their operations—from transportation and energy use to office hardware. An often-overlooked area is copier rentals. With many companies renting multifunction printers (MFPs) and copiers, sustainability trends in copier rentals are becoming a key factor in both procurement and operational strategy.

In this guide, we'll explore why green initiatives matter in copier rentals, highlight five major sustainability trends, and provide practical steps for businesses aiming to reduce their environmental footprint.

Why Sustainability Matters in Copier Rentals

Every office device has an ecological footprint. Copiers consume electricity, use paper and toner, and eventually contribute to electronic waste (e-waste). By focusing on sustainable rental solutions, companies can:

  • Reduce energy consumption and utility costs

  • Minimize paper, plastic, and toner waste

  • Promote corporate responsibility and green branding

  • Stay compliant with environmental regulations

Implementing sustainability trends isn’t just good for the planet—it’s smart business too.

1. ENERGY STAR® and Energy-Efficient Models

One of the most impactful trends in copier rentals is shifting to energy-efficient devices. Many providers now offer ENERGY STAR® certified machines that use less electricity without sacrificing performance.

Benefits include:

  • Lower power consumption, saving on utility bills

  • Reduced CO₂ emissions

  • Compatibility with eco-certified office spaces

Including ENERGY STAR® models in your rental choice helps align your office equipment with broader green goals.

2. Default Duplex Printing & Paper Reduction

Paper usage can be surprisingly high in many offices. To address this, providers are making duplex (double-sided) printing a default option on most rental models—reducing paper usage by up to 50%.

Other features driving paper efficiency:

  • Print previews and on-screen editing

  • Secure release, reducing waste from forgotten print jobs

  • Digital workflows like scan-to-email and scan-to-cloud

These strategies not only reduce waste but also cut costs in the long run.

3. Recyclable & Remanufactured Toner Cartridges

Toner cartridges are a significant source of plastic waste. In response, many rental providers now offer:

  • Recyclable cartridges that clients can return

  • Remanufactured options made from recycled components

  • Toner recycling programs included in service plans

These initiatives reduce landfill waste and offer a more circular lifecycle for consumables.

To learn how analytics help track and improve these efforts, explore The Role of Data Analytics in Copier Rentals.

4. Eco-Friendly Logistics & Equipment Lifecycle Management

Greener logistics are another rising trend. Many providers are now adopting:

  • Low-emission or electric delivery vehicles

  • Optimized routing to reduce transport emissions

  • Green packaging for shipments and returns

Plus, when machines reach their end of life, providers are implementing:

  • Proper recycling or refurbishment

  • Responsible disposal of electronic components

Choosing eco-conscious providers ensures responsible handling from installation through end-of-life process.

5. Cloud Integration & Reduced Local Infrastructure

Cloud integration not only boosts efficiency but also supports sustainability:

  • Eliminates the need for internal servers or local backups

  • Decreases energy usage from on-premise IT systems

  • Reduces hardware footprint in-office

Copier rentals with built-in cloud support also facilitate green digital workflows, making paper usage optional and traceable.

Want to learn more? See our post on the Adoption of Cloud Technology in Copier Rentals.

How Sustainability Aligns with Broader Office Trends

Multifunction Devices & Eco Efficiency

Modern MFPs—capable of printing, copying, scanning, and faxing—help consolidate devices, cut energy usage, and streamline workflows. Learn about these efficient models in our article on Demand for Multifunction Copiers.

Data & Analytics Support Green Goals

Monitoring print volumes, power usage, and waste via analytics helps businesses track improvements, identify inefficiencies, and justify eco-investments.

Overcoming Sustainability Challenges

Implementing green copier rentals comes with hurdles:

  1. Higher upfront costs for eco-certified models

  2. Provider limitations—not all providers offer green fleets

  3. User behavior changes—staff need to adapt habits

  4. Balancing sustainability with security and compliance

While challenges exist, the benefits—cost savings, brand equity, and environmental impact—make it worthwhile. Read about broader operational challenges in copier leasing in our post on Challenges Facing the Copier Rental Market.

5 Steps to Adopt Sustainable Copier Rentals

  1. Choose ENERGY STAR® models with duplex and sleep-mode features

  2. Select bundled recycling or remanufacture programs for toner

  3. Implement cloud workflows and encourage digital alternatives

  4. Use analytics tools to monitor resource use and identify gains

  5. Partner with green-minded providers that prioritize sustainability

Final Thoughts

Sustainability trends in copier rentals are transforming office equipment from simple machines into eco-friendly assets. By embracing energy efficiency, paper reduction, recyclable materials, green logistics, and cloud integration, businesses can significantly lower their environmental impact—and operational costs.

As offices worldwide aim to become greener, copier rentals offer a simple yet powerful way to make progress without compromising performance.
